title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 May 2016 - XWiki
content:
<lkrejci> has quit

01:27 <Daemoen> hey guys, is there an easy way to do the 'user gets dedicated space' similar to how confluence does it?  if you go to the users profile, it takes you to a page that not only contains their profile, but is also a space dedicated to them, quite efficient for lettings users have their own area for status pages, etc

12:09 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
12:09 <CylonSputnikk> Is there a working extension for 8.0 that allows creating a customizable navigation menu? None of the ones I'm trying seem to function for me or are broken.  
12:12 <vmassol> CylonSputnikk: the menu application?  
12:13 <vmassol> !search menu application  
12:13 <vmassol> first link  
12:13 <CylonSputnikk> I have the horizontal bar working, but I'd like a dynamic heirachy panel in my right column and following the example on that 1st link fails for me  
12:14 <CylonSputnikk> but perhaps i'm doing it wrong, as i'm still wrapping my head around xwiki  
12:14 <CylonSputnikk> I make a test page with the example code in the hierachy panel example and get the following error:  
12:15 <CylonSputnikk> org.xwiki.rendering.macro.MacroExecutionException: Nested scripts are not allowed. Current Script Macro [velocity] (source [xwiki:Menu.MenuMacro]) is executed inside Script Macro [velocity] (source [xwiki:Menu.MenuMacro])  
12:22 <CylonSputnikk> http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Menu+Application/Set+up+the+displaying+of+the+menu+in+right+left+panel+ doesn't seem to work either  
12:23 <vmassol> CylonSputnikk: for hierarchy you should use the Navigation Panel or directly the documentTree macro  
12:24 <CylonSputnikk> Is there a good doc for either to exclude elements as well as sort by title?  
12:24 <CylonSputnikk> for instance, there's an exclude example here: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Macro     but I can't get that to work either.  
12:27 <CylonSputnikk> I do the same thing, make a test page, paste that code. For that example, I literally get nothing on the resulting page.  
12:38 <CylonSputnikk> grrr. Made a page w/ the exclusion example. Created another page with a {tree} reference to the example page. {{tree reference="Xwiki.Test" /}}    All I get is a spinning loading icon :(  
12:38 <CylonSputnikk> no errors on screen or logs  
12:39 <ClemensR> should be {{tree reference="XWiki.Test" /}}   - are the browser tools not showing a 404 ?  
12:42 <CylonSputnikk> no 404s. I see calls to http://wiki/xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/DocumentTree with parameters and they come back with 200  
12:43 <CylonSputnikk> although...  
12:44 <CylonSputnikk> https://img42.com/srTco  
12:44 <CylonSputnikk> there's a jquery error between 3 successfull DocumentTree calls (which if I browse to manually, return what looks like proper json)  
12:47 <CylonSputnikk> it's jquery 1.11.3. Should I manually update it to 1.12?  
12:47 <vmassol> lunch time, bbl  
12:50 <ClemensR> hm, that is odd. I guess a newer jQuery version will not fix that. it seems the response contains some unexpected stuff ... hmm  
12:50 <CylonSputnikk> anyway to tell what it doesn't like?  
12:51 <ClemensR> the first one is what you are trying to show, anyway, that should be the filtered list of pages  
12:51 <CylonSputnikk> the first json call you mean?  
12:51 <ClemensR> yes, I think so, this calls your Xwiki.Test page  
12:54 <CylonSputnikk> http://pastebin.com/Ei9ezAKV  
12:54 <CylonSputnikk> is the json response from t he 1stone  
12:54 <CylonSputnikk> https://jsonformatter.curiousconcept.com/ to clean it up  
12:54 <CylonSputnikk> and the validator says it's good  
12:56 <ClemensR> ah, ok I can reproduce ... the JS error is really from the call to Xwiki.Test  
12:57 <CylonSputnikk> http://wiki/xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/Test?outputSyntax=plain&data=children&id=%23      is the attempt before the 3 tree calls.  
12:57 <CylonSputnikk> and browsing to it manually results in a blank page  
12:58 <ClemensR> ah, yes  
12:58 <ClemensR> it should be  {{tree  reference="Xwiki.Test.WebHome" /}}  
12:58 <CylonSputnikk> so does http://wiki/xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki actually.  
12:58 <ClemensR> that is because it is not a "terminal page"  
12:59 <ClemensR> http://wiki/xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/  instead  
12:59 <msmeria1> has quit  
13:00 <CylonSputnikk> same result  
13:00 <ClemensR> appending '.WebHome'  should be better, that is the non-obvious part with the new "nested spaces"  
13:00 <ClemensR> ah, still same? strange  
13:00 <ClemensR> http://wiki/xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/Test/?outputSyntax=plain&data=children&id=%23   still empty?  
13:01 <CylonSputnikk> https://img42.com/iQGru  
13:02 <CylonSputnikk> https://img42.com/Q809X  
13:02 <CylonSputnikk> still empty  
13:02 <ClemensR> hm, this does not send any parameter like  /xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/Test/WebHome?outputSyntax=plain&data=children&id=%23  
13:02 <ClemensR> hmpf, still empty, stange  
13:03 <ClemensR> not here, it senda  bunch of  [{"id":"document:xwiki:Admin.WebHome","text":"XWiki Advanced Administration Tools","icon":"fa fa-file-o","children":true,"  ... and so on  
13:03 <CylonSputnikk> the documenttree calls below it return json data like so  
13:04 <ClemensR> narf, so your wiki page should do the same, as you just pasted it form the example on the page  
13:04 <ClemensR> ah, wait, another idea ... let me check something  
13:06 <ClemensR> hm, no, it is not a rigths issue, as this should create an error message  
13:06 <ClemensR> and not an empty page  
13:06 <CylonSputnikk> i'm admin anyways  
13:08 <CylonSputnikk> grrrrrr  
13:08 <ClemensR> you do not run into the $response.sendError(404)   path of the script either, as that would return something either  
13:09 <ClemensR> and it is not a cache issue, we just changed the url ...  
13:11 <CylonSputnikk> jetty is running this. should i switch to tomcat?  
13:12 <ClemensR> jetty here, too  
13:13 <CylonSputnikk> i see  
13:13 <CylonSputnikk> not a browser issue. chrome does th e same thing  
13:14 <CylonSputnikk> Uncaught TypeError: Cannot use 'in' operator to search for 'length' in  
13:14 <CylonSputnikk> var length = "length" in obj && obj.length  
13:14 <CylonSputnikk> so sounds like you're right. its the empty non-json result making it crap out  
13:16 <ClemensR> can you just insert a []  in the top of the wiki page ? then it is no longer empty, I mean it should really not  
13:17 <CylonSputnikk> in Xwiki.Test?  
13:17 <CylonSputnikk> Xwiki.Test contains the example hierachy panel code  
13:17 <CylonSputnikk> you want me to put [] at the top?  
13:17 <ClemensR> yes, just to see if it print /anything/ at all, just for debugging  
13:18 <ClemensR> to be removed as soon as you see it in the browser  
13:18 <CylonSputnikk> Test/WebHome?outputSyntax=plain&data=children&id=%23 still empty  
13:18 <CylonSputnikk> get/Xwiki/Test?outputSyntax=plain&data=children&id=%23 also still empty  
13:18 <ClemensR> hm, so you edit the wiki page and the result is still empty ? huh ?  
13:19 <ClemensR> view/Xwiki/Test/ is empty page either ?  
13:20 <CylonSputnikk> view/Xwiki/Test/: https://img42.com/Dv17h  
13:20 <ClemensR> ok, so this does return something .. .the hard wired empty braces  
13:21 <CylonSputnikk> bin/get/Xwiki/Test?outputSyntax=plain&data=children&id=%23: https://img42.com/4aI24  
13:22 <ClemensR> it even seems to return HTML as content type  
13:22 <CylonSputnikk> yes  
13:23 <ClemensR> there is a '#if ($xcontext.action == 'get')'  in the sample code where the action starts and it seems we doi not even get there  
13:23 <ClemensR> hm, ah, we do not even get to the page at all, as we do not even get the lone []  
13:23 <CylonSputnikk> https://img42.com/6jxmX  
13:24 <ClemensR> soemthing eats all the response as soon as the view type is "get"  
13:24 <ClemensR> is there something in front of the jetty ?  
13:25 <CylonSputnikk> apache  
13:25 <CylonSputnikk> gonna try turning multilingual off  
13:25 <CylonSputnikk> i get a java warning that getter is deprecated  
13:25 <ClemensR> yes, that is ok  
13:26 <ClemensR> do you see the "get" request in the jetty access log?  
13:26 <CylonSputnikk> mmm.... let me see. i haven't looked at the jetty access log  
13:26 <CylonSputnikk> all i've ever seen is the error log  
13:27 <ClemensR> ah, then it has no access log enabled, probaly  
13:27 <CylonSputnikk> let me fix that  
13:27 <CylonSputnikk> and let me try jetty direct  
13:27 <CylonSputnikk> same result  
13:27 <CylonSputnikk> access log time  
13:28 <ClemensR> ouh, oh, very strange  
13:39 <CylonSputnikk> hmmm.  
13:39 <CylonSputnikk> stupid access log  
13:42 <CylonSputnikk> ok phew. request log going  
13:42 <CylonSputnikk> what do we want to know? do we see the request for get/Xwiki/Test?  
13:43 <CylonSputnikk> yes  
13:43 <CylonSputnikk> 192.168.0.117 - - [11/May/2016:11:42:39 +0000] "GET //192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/Test?outputSyntax=plain&data=children&id=%23 HTTP/1.1" 200 0  
13:46 <ClemensR> phwt, size 0  
13:47 <ClemensR> even with trailing slash I guess, e.g. //192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/Test/?outputSyntax=plain&data=children&id=%23  
13:47 <ClemensR> hm, wait, should be GET /xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/Test  
13:47 <ClemensR> without the IP adress in the url, or are the other entires the same ?  
13:48 <CylonSputnikk> the same  
13:48 <CylonSputnikk> i'm hitting jetty directly to eliminate apache  
13:49 <ClemensR> ok, but to the pages that work also show the IP number in the log ?  
13:49 <CylonSputnikk> yes  
13:49 <ClemensR> i.e. /xwiki/bin/view/Xwiki/Test/  
13:49 <ClemensR> ah, ok then it is just the log format  
13:51 <ClemensR> so if you directly call  /xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/Test/   without parameter it returns an empty page of size 0  
13:51 <ClemensR> and for   /xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/  the same ...  also same for /xwiki/bin/get/  ?  
13:52 <CylonSputnikk> checking now. meantime, enabled debug log. relevant entries if they help: http://pastebin.com/TnhCDfis  
13:53 <CylonSputnikk> http://192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/Test/ = empty  
13:53 <CylonSputnikk> http://192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/ = empty  
13:53 <CylonSputnikk> http://192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/get/ returns raw html  
13:54 <CylonSputnikk> https://img42.com/trWRF  
13:54 <ClemensR> phwft, I get the raw html in the last case, too, but still get "something" for   /xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki/  
13:54 <ClemensR> what does /xwiki/bin/view/Xwiki/?viewer=code  contain ?  
13:55 <tmortagne> ClemensR: "I get the raw html" that's because the default mime type with /get/ action is plain text  
13:56 <ClemensR> yes, and that is ok and expected  
13:56 <tmortagne> but this is not an issue since you are not really supposed to use /get/ directly as a human  
13:56 <ClemensR> it is not expected that the other existing pages return raw text/plain but are totally empty  
13:56 <CylonSputnikk> http://192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Xwiki/?viewer=code       returns a pretty page with "the requested page could not be found"  
13:57 <ClemensR> we added even some dummy dummy content to Xwiki.test  
13:57 <ClemensR> ah, how comes the Xwiki.Test page exisrs, and Xwiki.WebHome does not?  
13:57 <tmortagne> if the result is empty then it mean the page execution does not produce anything  
13:57 <tmortagne> (or the page does not exist)  
13:58 <tmortagne> Xwiki.WebHome is just a page  
13:58 <tmortagne> it's not mandatory to have a WebHome page  
13:58 <ClemensR> do you see a "You can edit this page to crate it"  link? magte try to add a dummy page tosee if it helps  
13:58 <ClemensR> s/magte/maybe/  
13:59 <CylonSputnikk> when browsing to http://192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Xwiki/?viewer=code ?  
14:00 <ClemensR> yes  
14:00 <CylonSputnikk> wait .. i'm an idiot  
14:00 <CylonSputnikk> W needed capitalized  
14:00 <ClemensR> well, that is better an misbehaving computers, as that is easier to fix nowadays  
14:00 <CylonSputnikk> http://192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/?viewer=code returns a velocity script  
14:01 <ClemensR> yes, that is the main wiki space  
14:01 <ClemensR> it should work with Xwiki.test anyway, as you created the page there  
14:01 <ClemensR> but for convenience you could move it to XWiki.Test and see if it works better there  
14:01 <CylonSputnikk> http://192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Test/?viewer=code ?  
14:02 <ClemensR> but I just tried, it should work even though the Xwiki.WebHome does not exists  
14:02 <CylonSputnikk> http://192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Test/?viewer=code = returns the example hierac panel and our []  
14:02 <ClemensR> ah, oh, so page is really there  
14:03 <CylonSputnikk> omg  
14:03 <CylonSputnikk> omg  
14:03 <ClemensR> ah, so why is there no proper 404 for Xwiki.Test ?  
14:03 <CylonSputnikk> dunno. i had the tree include reference not capitalized. fixed, but still same result  
14:04 <ClemensR> ok, in any case better scrap the [] no, as this breaks the example :)  
14:04 <CylonSputnikk> unless i'm caching  
14:04 <ClemensR> so  http://192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/bin/get/XWiki/Test/?outputSyntax=plain&data=children&id=%23   is still empty?  
14:05 <CylonSputnikk> no longer empty  
14:05 <CylonSputnikk> let me validate that json#  
14:06 <CylonSputnikk> valid  
14:06 <ClemensR> ok, then {{tree reference="XWiki.Test.WebHome" /}}   should work  
14:06 <CylonSputnikk> sorry to have taken us the wrong road due to capilzation  
14:06 <CylonSputnikk> ok trying now  
14:07 <CylonSputnikk> {{tree reference="XWiki.Test.WebHome" /}} it is  
14:07 <CylonSputnikk> i think i love you dude  
14:07 <CylonSputnikk> thank you for plugging away at this with me  
14:07 <ClemensR> the odd thing is that you could not get a 404 back for Xwiki.Test  as that is not supposed to exist  
14:07 <ClemensR> anyway, glad that it works now  
14:08 <ClemensR> now I have to debug my own problem instead, \*sigh\*  ;)  
14:08 <CylonSputnikk> i feel a little stupid for that capitalization thing  
14:08 <CylonSputnikk> um. i wish i could help? :)  
14:08 <CylonSputnikk> if you have a networking problem i could probably help heh  
14:09 <ClemensR> nah, deep debugging my own rotten code, I guess I deserve that :D  (not even XWiki related)  
14:09 <tmortagne> CylonSputnikk: what you could do is report a bug on http://jira.xwiki.org for not getting a 404 error when the page does not exist  
14:10 <tmortagne> important thing is to explain how to reproduce it on a standard distribution  
14:10 <ClemensR> well, I get a 404 with the standard jetty hsql distro  
14:10 <tmortagne> ok  
14:10 <tmortagne> very weird then  
14:10 <ClemensR> ah, no, I do not ....  
14:11 <ClemensR> so  wget -S --user=Admin --password=admin http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/get/Xwiki3/Test/?basicauth=1   -> HTTP/1.1 200 OK  
14:12 <ClemensR> but wget -S --user=Admin --password=admin http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Xwiki3/Test/?basicauth=1   -> proper 404  
14:12 <tmortagne> probably a bug in GetAction then  
14:12 <ClemensR> yes, looks like a bug to me, too  
14:16 <ClemensR> oh, someone might hate me if I manage to fix XWIKI-12935  tomorrow - new screenshots  
14:20 <moep> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:25 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:03 <msmeria> has quit  
15:03 <tmortagne> ClemensR: re MOCCACAL-102 I looked at the template and the option is off in the template  
15:04 <tmortagne> but if I click on the calendar to create a new event it's on  
15:04 <tmortagne> so the template does not seems to be taken into account  
15:04 <ClemensR> ah, ok, then it is odd. I see option is not set in the xml file  
15:04 <tmortagne> I'm in my test jetty/hsqldb 8.0 instance  
15:05 <ClemensR> I cannot reproduce with 8.1rc1, now trying with 8.0, but maybe it is an odd browser issue  
15:05 <tmortagne> but it is on in the new event UI  
15:05 <ClemensR> sigh, one of /these/ bugs  
15:06 <tmortagne> ClemensR: I have the issue in all browsers  
15:09 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
15:09 <ClemensR> darn, here too FF and chrome on linux, and it is not soo hard to see a checked="checked" or not  
15:09 <tmortagne> I really doubt it's related to some special browser  
15:10 <tmortagne> xwiki.org is back  
15:10 <vmassol> not yet for me but coming up  
15:11 <tmortagne> main wiki is  
15:12 <tmortagne> each wiki has also some init  
15:12 <tmortagne> (like a different less build for each wiki for example)  
15:14 <ClemensR> e.x.o back, too ... now retrying with that issue  
15:15 <tmortagne> ClemensR: changing the issue for bug since according to the template it's supposed to be off by default  
15:15 <ClemensR> yes, I hope I can finally reproduce the darn thing  
15:20 <tmortagne> ClemensR: you go to the calendar and click on it to get a popup with new event, right ?  
15:20 <ClemensR> the complete HTML for the "create new event" is generated on the server and just pasted into the dialog, and the sheet just does a dump   $doc.display('description')  
15:20 <ClemensR> yes, right  
15:20 <tmortagne> and it's off ?  
15:20 <ClemensR> on the top level and if I am in a certain calendar, no difference, it is off  
15:21 <ClemensR> something like  <input id="MoccaCalendar.MoccaCalendarEventClass\_0\_allDay" type="checkbox" value="1" name="MoccaCalendar.MoccaCalendarEventClass\_0\_allDay">  
15:21 <tmortagne> I don't create any calendar, I just go to my newly installed calendar and click on it  
15:21 <ClemensR> cannot just smuggle in a 'checked="checked"'  
15:21 <ClemensR> ah, wait  
15:21 <tmortagne> and I see it on, I did not looked at the html  
15:22 <ClemensR> you click on the calendar itself, not on the button!  
15:22 <tmortagne> yes the calendar itself  
15:22 <tmortagne> that what most people do, Google calendar reflex  
15:22 <ClemensR> I always click on that blue button in the upper right, thats why  
15:22 <ClemensR> ok, then I can reproduce, it seems FullCalendar sets the flag  
15:23 <ClemensR> phew figured it finally  
15:23 <tmortagne> :)  
15:25 <ClemensR> yes, ok, I guess it will be hard to unset it without patching FullCalendar, but having a listener for the date fields should be manageable  
15:26 <boubou> hum guys... I have a question. I have a Xwiki 7.0.1 and I upgraded to xwiki 8.0 easily like compting to 123  
15:26 <boubou> why backup permentent data folder ?  
15:27 <boubou> I backuped it yes but I didnt restore it on the new xwiki and all seem to work  
15:28 <tmortagne> ClemensR: maybe there is some way to "configure" fullcalendar  
15:29 <tmortagne> boubou: permanent dir contains extensions  
15:29 <ClemensR> boubou: the version information of your extension and the default UI will be lost; you find out on the next update  
15:30 <tmortagne> XAR extension seems to work only because the page are in the database anyway but jar extension won't work and you will have a bad surprise next time you try upgrade or install anything  
15:30 <boubou> it doesnt have many installed extensions  
15:30 <tmortagne> boubou: it does  
15:30 <boubou> and we use the defaut UI  
15:30 <tmortagne> the whole standard UI is a set of extensions  
15:30 <tmortagne> that's what the wizard does: install/upgrade UI extensions  
15:30 <boubou> what will be miss if I dont restore it ?  
15:31 <tmortagne> again you still have the page but upgrading pages will be a nightmare  
15:31 <tmortagne> you will have to repair it, etc.
